alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 2:56AM PST until February 23 at 6:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Damage to trees and power lines is possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, with localized amounts up to 18 inches on the higher peaks, are expected. * WHERE...San Diego County Mountains, including along Interstate 8. * WHEN...4 PM today to 6 PM Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.
